body.body: Incubate in a quartz cell 10 μl of biological sample \(from each re-dissolved chromatographic fraction) with 50 μl trypsin \(33 μg ml<sup>-1</sup> in 20 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub>, 0.1 M Tris, pH 8.0) and 790 μl activity buffer \(20 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub>, 0.1 M Tris, pH 8.0) for 3 min at room temperature.

body.title: Step 1
body.body: in another quartz cell and add 10 μl activity buffer \(20 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub>, 0.1 M Tris, pH 8.0) instead of biological sample in order to obtain the control sample.
Add 150 μl of the substrate N-benzoyl-arginine ethyl ester hydrochloride to each quartz cell \(see REAGENTS).
Gently mix all the quartz cells and measure the absorbance change at 254 nm and 25 °C over 2 min, producing 240 time points \(signal averaging time = 0.5 s).
Control slopes should be 0.050 ± 0.003 units of absorbance \(U.Abs.) per min.
Biological samples yielding slopes below 0.035 U.Abs. per min are taken for intensity fading MS assays.

Incubate in a quartz cell 10 μl biological sample \(from each re-dissolved chromatographic fraction) with 2 μl carboxypeptidase A \(35 μg ml<sup>-1</sup> in 20 mM Tri-HCl buffer, 0.5 M NaCl, pH 7.5) and 978 μl activity buffer \(20 mM Tri-HCl buffer, 0.5 M NaCl, pH 7.5) for 3 min at room temperature.

body.title: Step 1
body.body: in another quartz cell and add 10 μl activity buffer \(50 mM Tri-HCl buffer, 100 mM NaCl, pH 7.5) instead of biological sample in order to obtain the control sample.
Add 10 μl of the substrate N-\(4-methoxyphenylazoformyl)-Phe-OH to each quartz cell \(see REAGENTS).
Gently mix all the quartz cells and measure the absorbance change at 350 nm and 25 °C over 3 min, producing 360 time points \(signal averaging time = 0.5 s).
Control slopes should be 0.12 ± 0.02 U.Abs. per min.
Biological samples yielding slopes below 0.060 U.Abs. per min are taken for 'intensity fading MS' assays.
